keyword: how many calories in a cutie
title: How Many Calories Are in a Cutie?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a cutie, including carbs, fiber, sugars, protein, fat, and full nutrition breakdown for this sweet mandarin orange.
h1: How Many Calories Are in a Cutie?
assumptions: One medium Cutie (small mandarin orange, ~76 g), fresh, peeled, no added sugars or toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by size, ripeness, brand, and growing conditions. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One Cutie provides about 40 kcal, mostly from natural sugars, with 1.3 g fiber.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a Cutie mandarin?
What are the carbs in a Cutie?
faqs.a: Around 10 g carbs, including 1.3 g fiber and 8 g natural sugars.

faqs.q: Is a Cutie low in fat and protein?
faqs.a: Yes, only 0.2 g fat and 0.6 g protein per Cutie.

faqs.q: How does Cutie size affect calories?
faqs.a: Smaller Cuties (~70 g) have ~35 kcal; larger (~85 g) up to 45 kcal.

faqs.q: Are Cuties good for sodium intake?
faqs.a: Very low sodium at just 2 mg per Cutie, ideal for low-sodium diets.
